I have no problem with Sickboy's sick logo on this sick film. So what?  (It it pretty sick.)

Anyhow, try AVIDEMUX.  Convert it to Xvid or auto DVD format.  It works.  Then most DVD makers will deal with it.  I think it's kinda silly to use the MKV format for a 60s B/W flick when Divx would do, but it's not so much trouble.

What's worse is people who ZIP or RAR the entire movie so it cannot be seeded efficiently, and then you have to keep the Zipped and the Unzipped version.

I say, Divx3 or Divx5 esp for older flicks, unless it needs super image quality.
